intro: Brayopsis weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's brayopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the Andean region of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Brayopsis weberbaueri is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
